text: Chris "C.J." Henderson (December 26, 1951 - July 4, 2014) was an American writer. He wrote books of horror and hardboiled crime fiction genres. He also comic books and was influenced by Stan Lee. Henderson was known for creating the Jack Hagee detective series and his supernatural detective Teddy London series. Henderson died in Brooklyn, New York from cancer, aged 62. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1951 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:American comics writers
title: C. J. Henderson
